intro: Curcas adansonii, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Spurge family (Euphorbiaceae) and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsule fruits containing seeds. Curcas adansonii is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
